item.name: Antimagic Spiked Armor
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to give yourself advantage on a saving throw you make against a spell. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn. In addition, while you wear this armor, you can use it to cast Antimagic Field, requiring no spell components. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 65, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Antimagic Spiked Barding
item.detail: tack and harness, very rare (requires attunement)
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to give yourself advantage on a saving throw you make against a spell. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn. In addition, while you wear this armor, you can use it to cast Antimagic Field, requiring no spell components. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body.
Spiked barding provides a mount with an AC equal to 14 + the mount's Dexterity modifier (max 2). The mount makes Dexterity (Stealth) checks with disadvantage.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 65, Player's Handbook (2014) p. 157, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Armor of Fungal Spores
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you can take a bonus action to make the armor emit poisonous spores, which fill a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on yourself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 65, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Armor of the Fallen
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you can use it to cast either Speak with Dead or Animate Dead. Once the armor has cast a spell in this way, it can't cast either spell until the next dawn. Your soul keeps this armor together. If you die while you are attuned to the armor, the armor is destroyed.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 65, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Armor of Weightlessness
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
This armor has 5 charges. While you wear it, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from the armor, targeting yourself: Jump (1 charge) or Levitate (2 charges). This armor regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 65, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Feywrought Spiked Armor
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
This colorful, flowery armor was forged in the Feywild and is infused with that plane's captivating magic. While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself. This armor has 3 charges. You can use an action to expend a charge to cast the Compulsion spell (save DC 15) from this armor. The armor regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: The Book of Many Things p. 67, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121
